metadata.title: CVE-2020-26952 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
Incorrect bookkeeping of functions inlined during JIT compilation could have led to memory corruption and a potentially exploitable crash when handling out-of-memory errors. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 83.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2020-26952` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 83.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 83.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 83.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '83.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
